product_description.product_name: Coal Ash (including Fly Ash), Class C and Class F
product_description.usage: Coal ash is a pre-consumer recycled material used in concrete construction, improving workability, decreasing permeability, reducing sulfate attack, enhancing bleeding and segregation, reducing shrinkage, reducing heat of hydration, increasing compressive and flexural strength.
product_description.composition: Primarily silicate glass containing silica, alumina, iron, and calcium. Minor constituents include magnesium, sulfur, sodium, potassium, and carbon.
product_description.types: Class C or Class F as categorized by ASTM C618 and AASHTO M 295.

lca_information.physical_chemical_properties: Manufactured to conform to all applicable requirements for the designated class of ASTM C618 and AASHTO M 295.

transport_and_installation.installation_requirements: Consult application specifications and guides from ASTM, ACI, ACAA, or other reputable industry organizations.
transport_and_installation.methods: Proper proportioning, batching, mixing, placing, consolidating, finishing, and curing are critical. The water-cement ratio is especially critical to durable, strong concrete.
transport_and_installation.safety_precautions: Refer to the applicable Safety Data Sheet (SDS). Avoid direct contact with the skin. Proper PPE is required.

recycled_materials_handling.source: By-product of the combustion of pulverized coal at power generating plants.
recycled_materials_handling.processing: Collected from exhaust gases by electrostatic precipitators or bag filters. Needs no further processing for use in blended cement or concrete.
